skill.name: writing-skills
skill.description: Use when creating new skills, editing existing skills, or verifying skills work before deployment
skill.summary: Use when creating new skills, editing existing skills, or verifying skills work before deployment
skill.author: CodingCossack

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill with no executable code, network access, or filesystem modifications. The only supporting script (render-graphs.js) safely executes the Graphviz dot utility for rendering diagrams to SVG files.

content.value_statement: Agents repeatedly make the same mistakes across sessions. This skill provides a test-driven methodology for documenting proven techniques as reusable skills that future Claude instances can apply immediately.
actual_capabilities: Apply RED-GREEN-REFACTOR cycle to skill documentation
Write pressure scenarios to test skill compliance
Design skills using persuasion principles for better agent adherence
Create Graphviz flowcharts for decision documentation
Structure skills with Claude Search Optimization for discoverability
Bulletproof discipline-enforcing skills against agent rationalization
limitations: Does not execute code or modify files automatically
Requires manual testing with subagents to verify skill effectiveness
Does not provide pre-built skills for specific domains

use_cases.title: Create Reusable Skills
use_cases.description: Document proven techniques as skills that prevent recurring mistakes across sessions

use_cases.title: Standardize Agent Behavior
use_cases.description: Establish consistent workflows by encoding best practices as verified skills

use_cases.title: Apply Test-Driven Development
use_cases.description: Use pressure scenarios to validate skills work before deployment

prompt_templates.title: Basic Skill Creation
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to create a skill for [technique]. Walk me through the RED-GREEN-REFACTOR process. First, what baseline test should I run?

prompt_templates.title: Testing Existing Skills
prompt_templates.prompt: Test my [skill-name] skill under pressure. Create 3 scenarios with combined pressures (time, sunk cost, exhaustion) and run them without the skill loaded.

prompt_templates.title: Closing Rationalization Loopholes
prompt_templates.prompt: My [skill-name] skill failed under pressure. The agent rationalized by saying: '[exact quote]'. How should I update the skill to counter this specific loophole?

prompt_templates.title: Designing Persuasive Skills
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me apply persuasion principles to my [skill-type] skill. Which principles (authority, commitment, scarcity, social proof, unity) should I use and how?

output_examples.input: Help me create a skill for test-driven development
output: RED Phase: Write failing baseline test without the skill
GREEN Phase: Write minimal skill addressing specific failures
REFACTOR Phase: Close loopholes from additional testing
Use pressure scenarios: time pressure + sunk cost + exhaustion
Apply authority principle: 'YOU MUST write tests first'

best_practices: Always run baseline scenarios before writing skills - watch agents fail first
Combine 3+ pressures in test scenarios to reveal real rationalizations
Use persuasion principles systematically: authority + commitment for discipline skills
anti_patterns: Writing skills without testing them on agents first
Skipping RED phase and guessing what failures to prevent
Using generic counters like 'do not cheat' instead of specific loophole negation

faq.question: What platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: Claude Code, Claude API, and Codex. All support skills-based workflow with identical behavior.

faq.question: What is the ideal skill length?
faq.answer: Keep SKILL.md under 500 lines. Frequently-loaded skills should be under 200 words total.

faq.question: How do I integrate with existing skills?
faq.answer: Reference other skills using their slug name. Use format: '**REQUIRED BACKGROUND:** You MUST understand superpowers:test-driven-development'.

faq.question: Is data stored or shared?
faq.answer: No. This skill contains only documentation. It does not access, store, or transmit any user data.

faq.question: What if skills fail testing?
faq.answer: Document exact rationalizations, add explicit counters, update description with violation symptoms, and re-test until bulletproof.

faq.question: How does this differ from regular documentation?
faq.answer: Skills follow TDD methodology. You test skills on agents under pressure before deploying, ensuring they actually change agent behavior.
